info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 24 at 10:54PM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT EAST CENTRAL GUERNSEY... NORTHEASTERN MONROE AND CENTRAL BELMONT COUNTIES THROUGH 1145 PM EDT... At 1054 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Barnesville, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... St. Clairsville, Barnesville, Bethesda, Belmont, Morristown, Neffs, Alledonia, Fairview, and Barkcamp State Park. This includes Interstate 70 in Ohio between mile markers 199 and 221. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
